author: Special Correspondent
text:
Tamil Nadu Towheed Jamath will conduct Shirk (idolatory) abolition conference at the state-level in Tiruchi on January 31.

The preparatory discussion for conduct of the event was chaired by TNTJ state president Fakir Muhammad Althafi here on Sunday. According to the organisers, lakhs of people are expected to attend the conference that will also spell out the organisation’s opposition to letting money on interest, superstitious practices, sorcery and witchcraft. Several resolutions including extricating Muslims from superstitions, abolition of idolatory, shunning of Yoga Guru Baba Ramdev’s Pathanjali products due to usage of cow urine, demand for total prohibition, demand for increasing reservation for Muslims in educational institutions and employment, stringent punishment for rape offenders irrespective of age, enhancement of flood relief to Rs. 50,000 for every unit of damaged hutments and Rs. 1 lakh for middle-class affected people, minimum of one lakh for each of the small traders who had lost their belongings in the flood, and preventing Hindu Maha Sabha leader Kamalesh Tiwari from denigrating Prophet Mohammed.

The TNTJ questioned the Central Government’s rationale behind releasing only Rs. 1,940 crore as flood relief to Tamil Nadu while setting apart Rs. 3,000 crore for installing statue of Sardar Vallabhai Patel.
title: TNTJ to hold state conference in Tiruchi
